Delegated ReportApproved by Area DC Practitioner:Signed....................................................................... Date.................................APPROVE - DISCHARGE OF CONDITION 3 of 04/00508/FUL.Application Number:	04/01395/DETApplication Address:	Shop, 10 York Rd, London.Sample:	nilDrawing:	One unlabelled drawingSite Description: The application site consists of a small part of a building located on the podium deck of the Shell Centre.  This is a raised paved and grassed piece of open space.  It is one of four single storey buildings on the podium.  One accommodates the fly tower of the auditorium, whilst the others provide fire exits from the basement and ventilation shafts from the basement car park.Immediately to the east of the site is Jubilee Gardens which is Metropolitan Open Land, to the north, the Shell Centre Upstream buildings.  To the south, across Chicheley Street, is County Hall and to the east, across York Road, is Elizabeth House.  The area contains a mix of uses; residential, retail, leisure and office.The site is within South Bank Conservation Area, CA38.  Planning History 04/00508/FUL - Change of use of retail unit from photocopying shop to police support office.98/01513/FUL - Change of use of retail unit (Photocopying Shop) to use as an office. Granted: 03.11.1998.  This permission was not implemented and expired at the end of last year.The site is within South Bank Conservation Area, CA38.  Proposed DevelopmentApproval of details pursuant of condition 3 (replacement single leaf door/side lights) of planning permission 04/00508/FUL (Temporary change of use for 3 years of retail unit from photocopying shop to police support office, together with alterations to the glazed entrance.) granted 31.03.2004.ConsultationsI have consulted the relevant neighbouring properties: No I have consulted the appropriate amenity groups and interested parties: NoPress Notice : No      Site Notice : No   Conservation and Design were consulted and made the following comment: "Both the material and design proposed for the shop-front are unsympathetic to the pavilion, out of keeping with the surrounding character of the CA? However there are other considerations in this particular case.  Planning permission for the redevelopment of the Shell Centre, and CA Consent for the demolition of the pavilions has already been granted.  Therefore the underlying purpose of conservation policy (the general presumption in favour of preservation) is almost impossible to achieve here. Moreover, since this is a retrospective application I do not know what condition the pavilion in question was in prior to the application- this might after all be better than what was there before.  Furthermore the public interest served by the police in this location (and particularly where they may be occupying a building that would other wise lie empty until it is demolished) might also be taken into account.Thus while the relevant policy here might suggest that a refusal was justified, it may not be the most reasonable option."PLANNING CONSIDERATIONSAdopted UDP: CD2 - Proposals for Development; CD17 - Shopfronts.Revised Deposit Draft UDP: Policy 34 Shopfronts and Advertisements; Policy 42 - Conservation Areas. The proposed door was already installed so could be viewed on site.  The door appeared suitable for the modern building and would not detract from the building or neighbouring buildings.ConclusionThe replacement door has a minor effect on the appearance of the building and constitutes only a small part of the elevation of building.    In light of the comments from the Conservation Officer it would appear that while the door and side lights may not be sympathetic to the building the fact that the permission to use the building is temporary and the building has CA consent to be demolished little would be achieved by refusing the application.      RecommendationApprove details.The proposed door is acceptable and as such condition 3 pursuant to planning permission Ref: 04/00508/FUL is discharged.

In deciding to grant listed building consent, the Council has had regard to the relevant Policies of the Development Plan and all other relevant material considerations. Having weighed the merits of the proposal in the context of these issues, it is considered that listed building consent should be granted subject to the conditions listed below. In reaching this decision the following Policies were relevant:Adopted Unitary Development Plan (1998)CD9, CD13Replacement Unitary Development Plan (2004) 41

MANDATORY CONDITIONSSupply of Alcohol1.	No supply of alcohol may be made under this licence:a)	At a time that there is no designated premises supervisor in respect of the premises licence; orb)	At a time when the designated premises supervisor does not hold a personal licence or his personal licence is suspended.2.	Every supply of alcohol under this licence must be made or authorised by a person who holds a personal licence.

Your attention is drawn to the provisions of The Party Wall Act 1996 in relation to the rights of adjoining owners regarding party walls etc.  These rights are a matter for civil enforcement and you may wish to consult a surveyor or architect.

You are advised of the necessity to consult the Council's Highways team on 020 7926 9000, prior to the commencement of construction, in order to obtain necessary approvals and licences prior to undertaking any works within the Public Highway including Scaffolding, Temporary/Permanent Crossovers, Oversailing/Undersailing of the Highway, Drainage/Sewer Connections, Hoarding, Excavations (including adjacent to the highway such as basements, etc), Temporary Full/Part Road Closures, Craneage Licences etc.

The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning from the date of this decision notice.Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans listed in this notice.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
